intro: Panctenis pectinata, commonly known as the silky plectritis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers arranged in umbrella-like clusters, a feature typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its delicate appearance and unique floral structure make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
